lines.text: Precious child. She's very sweet, but where in the world did she get that color hair and eyes?
Of course, it's only gossip... rumor. My mother said that nobody really knows.
Who I am? I'm me, of course. Mary Hagen.
That's just it. Are you Mary Hagen, or are you...?
I said, who am I? Please tell me the truth.
Who are you? Why-why, you're Mary. Our girl. Didn't I have you baptized by the Reverend Sparland? Didn't I raise you like other girls' mothers?
How 'bout it? C'mon, let's hit the high spots.
Why don't you go somewhere and catch yourself, you foul ball!
Mary, you're never gonna be happy if you're always gonna be sad. Now, you've got nice teeth and took two years of French, so why don't you look on the bright side of things!
